Params: Zavier, why is Hanying sleeping again?
Be good, kids. I'll play with you once she wakes up... Strange, the Gray Tower data flowing into the "cocoon" seems irregular...
The little mechanoids' laughter fades into the depths of darkness.
Further ahead, the data in the buffer area becomes completely unreadable.
In the temporary camp where human soldiers have stationed her, Hanying sits quietly, processing all her readable memories.
Whatever happened must have occurred while I was in dormancy. Zavier must know something about this. If I could just contact the Church...
Keeping away from the chattering soldiers, she attempts to contact Zavier.
Unexpectedly, all that comes through on the communication line is a faint, crackling sound of static.
She tries to contact several other Church of Machina members, but each attempt returns no connection.
In her last memory, Cervantes was traveling and not with the Church of Machina. The chances of reaching him now are the slimmest...
Through the static-filled transmission, Cervantes' face appears increasingly pale.
Cervantes, I can't reach Zavier, and all communication within the Church has gone down. What's happening?

The Church members have always depended on the network system centered around the Gray Tower for communications. A blackout of this magnitude probably means something has gone wrong with the Gray Tower itself.
In the best-case scenario, the Gray Tower has activated signal blocking to protect against an attack. Worst case... well, as you can see, I'm on my way back to the church to find out for sure.
So you're not at the Church either?
Yes, it looks like the signal blocking only affects transmissions close to the Gray Tower. That's why we can still communicate normally here.
After you got your frame replaced, I got a message from Sage and was getting ready to head back to the Church. But when I tried to reach Zavier after that, I couldn't get through to him anymore.
I see... so you don't know what happened while I was in dormancy either...
You were in a severely weakened state back then, so we should at least be grateful that you're safe now. However...
His expression grows even more grave as he glances at the Hetero-Forest behind Hanying.
Your new frame was lost along with "it," which isn't what we expected.
She keenly notices the deliberate pause in Cervantes' words.
One of the reasons I'm heading back to the Church is that Sage left behind another "key" before she departed.
This "key" might unlock the path forward—the future of the Church itself.
We still don't know why you ended up there. Perhaps the Church faced danger and was forced to send you away, or perhaps you were stolen away during the chaos...
Cervantes pauses, carefully weighing his next words.

If the Church comes through safely, the "key" will need to be properly secured. But... if something goes wrong, as long as we still hold onto this "future," there's still a chance to make things right.
Hanying closes her eyes as the children's laughter in her ears fades into the depths of her memory buffer.
She is still unaware of the purpose of the "key" that Cervantes speaks of, but the weight of the "future" is already all too clear.
It happened so suddenly—we never anticipated such an accident. Although the "key" is equipped with a locator, its coordinates haven't been updated for a long time...
Its last known location is near you, so I'll leave the search in your hands. Once I check things out at the Church, I'll head your way as soon as I can.
These coordinates... they're quite far from my position. What's at that location?
Justice severed her ties with the Church at that location.
Justice? Oh... you mean the mechanoid named Veronica?
Arcana mentioned that she was supposed to bring back the previous "Hanged Man", but after reporting their death, she never returned.
Yes. Veronica has always been one to act on her own accord. Her last known coordinates were updated near Aerospace City.
The signal was lost... Could something have happened to her?
She cut off the connection herself and never returned to the Church. Even though a lot of our fellow members wanted to push for Veronica's excommunication, Mother has been quite lenient with her.
We suspect she cut off the signal because of what happened to the previous Hanged Man.
You mean our fellow member who perished on their very first day at the Church...
Yes. Veronica only reported the death of the previous Hanged Man, but no one knows the details... In any case, be careful.
The situation within the church remains unclear, and the important items entrusted by Sage are still missing. A hint of weariness shows in Cervantes' eyes.
How are you adapting to the new frame? Though we had to rush its activation, Zavier's design should work just fine.
The compatibility is fine... but when the new frame activated, I think I had a "nightmare."
A nightmare? That's quite an odd occurrence.
Your incubation pod—the "cocoon"—shapes the frame according to the user's thoughts. Given your personality, you wouldn't fabricate fears out of nothing...
Perhaps there was already an issue with the Gray Tower's data at that time.

Back when you switched frames, the Gray Tower was also linked to the "cocoon" for computing support. Your nightmares might be related to the Gray Tower's anomaly. Have you noticed any unusual reactions from your frame since then?
I've run a self-diagnosis on my frame. Everything seems fine, but some memories in my buffer are missing...
It's like sinking into an ocean of thick ink. She desperately reaches out, yet her fingers grasp nothing but darkness.
Even fear itself drowns in the abyss.
That light... it guided me as I floated toward the surface.
Back then, it seemed to keep slipping away from me, yet that connection we shared...
An unknown signal just tried to connect to my Mind Beacon.
Your Mind Beacon? I didn't notice anything abnormal just now...
After reviewing all the data, Liv asks again.
Are you feeling all right, Commandant?
just followed along with the beacon...
We should do another check-up once we've settled down in the city.
Liv responds in a soft voice.
Don't worry about it too much.
Don't underestimate the God of M.I.N.D.
Pfft... We should still be careful though.
She checks all the data again, confirming there are no anomalies before moving forward.
We haven't lost him; he's just up ahead. We're far enough away that even a mechanoid won't catch our conversation.
But... can we really follow him through this minefield and into Aerospace City?
According to what Rosetta told you earlier, the awakened machines from Aerospace City set up this minefield. So, an awakened machine from there should know how to navigate through it.
Even though you don't know what awaits you inside Aerospace City, getting in there is your top priority right now.
Liv gives a gentle nod, her eyes fixed on the target ahead.

Traversing through the snow-laden forest, the narrow snowy path unfolds like a grand scroll, revealing a breathtaking vista at the forest's edge. Through the sea of trees, the silhouette of the city begins to take shape in the distance.
Tsk... the data trap didn't work...
Something... pulled her out of the data stream...
Hmph, can't stay here much longer. Better head back for now.
